page.title: 10Transport in Batley
page.content: There is a bus station in Batley.In the station there is a waiting room and,an information office and a newsagents.Every bus that goes through Batley stops in the station.Probably the most commonly used bus in Batley is the 281.This bus goes through Birstall,Batley and Dewsbury.there is also a free bus to Hillards which goes round the district picking up people.Buses run to all the major towns in the area. There is a railway station in Batley.Thereis a very small platform and ticket office.From this station you can go west towards Manchester,or, east towards Leeds. There are over 100 taxi cabs in Batley.The biggest taxi firm is Metro Taxis.It has over 45 taxis.In Batley alone there are about 10 taxi firms, some of which have only one cab.
